#Text=Gostivar
#Text=Gostivar ( Macedonian : Гостивар ) is a town in the Western North Macedonia .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Situated in the Polog Valley in northwestern Macedonia , Gostivar is near Mavrovo National Park and the source of the Vardar River .
#Text=Gostivar is the seat of the fourth most populous municipality in Macedonia , with over 80,000 residents .
#Text=The city itself has just over 35,000 residents , making it Polog 's second-largest city after Tetovo .
#Text=Gostivar is ethnically diverse with 47 % of the population identifying as Albanian , one-third as Macedonian , 13 % as Turkish , and the rest as Roma ( Gypsy ) or other .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Gostivar lies in the main road Skopje-Gostivar .
#Text=This road is smooth and nice but you have to pay a toll to drive on it .
#Text=See
#Text=Church of St Mary ( Црква „ Св .
#Text=Богородица “ ) .
#Text=This church stands prominently on the central square of the city .
#Text=It was built in 1923 and contains a prominent central tower .
#Text=Clock Tower ( Саат-кула ) .
#Text=Gostivar 's clock tower is one of its main symbols , found on both the city flag and coat of arms .
#Text=It was built in 1729 by Ismail Aga ; the date is inscribed in Ottoman Turkish on a stone atop the entrance .
#Text=Located in central Gostivar , this clock tower is among the better preserved ones in Macedonia and still displays the correct time .
#Text=Bey 's House ( Бегова куќа ) .
#Text=Also known as the Yellow House , this is the oldest existing building in Gostivar .
#Text=It was built in the 18th or 19th century for a wealthy Turkish family , designed with oriental elements by Daut Boletini .
#Text=Further afield
#Text=Vrutok is a village in which the source of Macedonia 's most important river is found .
#Text=Located on the slopes of Mount Bistra , it is home to multiple fish restaurants at the source of the Vardar .
#Text=The village , southwest of Gostivar city , is home to over 1,100 residents .
#Text=Brodec is a mountain village in the west of Gostivar Municipality with the largest area of any village in Macedonia .
#Text=While Brodec is nearly completely depopulated today , it has much traditional village architecture worth seeing , complemented by the mountainous scenery .
#Text=It also features a monastery complex established in 2015 and a small waterfall .
#Text=Church of St Nicholas ( Црква „ Св . Никола “ ) ( village of Brodec ) .
#Text=The main church of Brodec , St Nicholas was built in the 19th century .
#Text=It has a single dome and features interior painting of the Mijak style .
#Text=Notable sites in other villages of the municipality include the below .
#Text=Church of Sts Peter and Paul ( Црква „ Св .
#Text=Петар и Павле “ ) ( village of Dolna Banjica ) .
#Text=This 19th century church was built of stone .
#Text=The main church of this village , it is also situated near medieval ruins of a necropolis .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Imerial Restaurant , ☏ +389-361-762 .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Imperial Motel , ☏ +389-361-762 .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Mavrovo National Park
#Text=Tetovo
